As the first day of the 2020-2021 school year rapidly approaches, we ask that families for any student who will be a remote learner beginning on complete the survey available by clicking the links below. Your response is requested by August 16, 2020.

Breakfast and lunch will be available for pick up at the EEC from 8:30-10am each school day.
The name and home campus of the student will be required for meal delivery.
Students will be charged for meals as follows in accordance with their eligibility status:
Regular Priced Meals:
Breakfast
Grades K-12: $1.90
Lunch
Grades K-5: $2.85
Grades: 6-12: $3.10
Reduced Price Meals:
Breakfast, All Grades: $0.30
Lunch, All Grades: $0.40
If a student qualifies for free meals, they will not be charged.
Families can apply for free/reduced priced meals online at www.mymealtime.com

Krum High School Softball is extremely excited to announce that we have a new head coach: Lindsey Lyles! Coach Lyles joined Krum ISD last year after leaving Whitney ISD where she served as the assistant softball coach. We are extremely excited about the insight Coach Lyles will bring to the job as a former collegiate softball player at Texas A&M Corpus Christi. She will be assisted by Coach Keely Baker, who has served KHS Softball for the last two years, as well as 6 years as a softball assistant in Little Elm. KHS Softball is also excited to welcome another coach to the team- Coach Lynn Larson! Coach Larson joins our LadyCat softball coaching staff with eight years of combined softball coaching experience from her time with Graham, Brock, and Bridgeport ISDs.

Who's ready for Week 2 of #SummerScience? 👩‍🔬👨‍🔬

Today's experiment defies the laws of science as they pertain to matter! We know there are three main states of matter-solids, liquids, and gasses. But in this experiment, you'll create something that acts as a solid AND a liquid!

👉What you'll need: Water, Corn Starch, and a large container

With the increased stress in everyone's lives due to COVID-19 practicing mindfulness each day can be a useful practice! Some of our students were using the app "I Am Present" in class, but you can download it to use at home, too! This app is available in the Google Play Store and Apple App Store. According to their website, practicing daily mindfulness not only helps to reduce stress but also to enhance learning and resiliency. Learn more at their website iampresent.org or download the app today!

We are incredibly grateful to these men and women for their dedication to Krum ISD and their support of our students and teachers.

Beginning January 6, 2020, contractors will begin road expansion of FM 1173 in the area of Camden Creek Road of the Fowler Farm subdivision. TxDOT has required this road work as part of the Fowler Farm subdivision.
The work will involve widening FM 1173 and reconstructing associated storm drainage utilities. The project will have a duration of approximately two months. For approximately two weeks of the two months, Blackforest Road will be closed at FM 1173.

The contractors will be following a TxDOT approved traffic control plan and will be placing warning signs and detours as appropriate.

This work, particularly the road closure, may affect school traffic so please plan accordingly.

Hattie Dyer Elementary
September 10, 2019 at 8:47 AM ·

At the end of last school year, Dyer second grade teacher Mrs. Reed entered a contest to have the Denton based store SCRAP come do an hour of art in her classroom.
She won!

Yesterday, Jacie from SCRAP came and conducted a hands-on craft lesson with Mrs. Reed's class. Jacie discussed the importance of reducing, reusing, and recycling with students before showing them various crafts made from items that are reused! Students saw flowers made from bottle caps and silly straws, a bumblebee made from old CDs and map paper, and a jellyfish made from ribbons, fabric, and bottle caps!

Then, students were able to make a self-portrait using scraps of fabric and buttons. Our students were really able to showcase their creativity, using fun patterns and colors to create hair and clothes for their self-portraits.

Thank you SCRAP Denton for this incredible and fun opportunity!
